data.title: Viewport cleanup
data.body:
Part 3/N of cleanups in preparation for TS/RA2 terrain support.

This simplifies the viewport code and removes inherent assumptions about tile geometry.
The viewport object has been moved from Game into WorldRenderer.

data.title: Remove legacy PPos type.
data.body:
Part 2/N of cleanups in preparation for TS/RA2 terrain support.
Mostly code cleanup - the main visible change is that minefields now render with a PBOG-style tile overlay.

data.title: Ant selection box is way too big
Bullet and missile Contrail problems
data.body:
The Contrail code for projectiles (maybe other contrails as well) seems to have some issues.

1) Setting ContrailDelay to 0 causes a fatal error when trying to launch the game.

2) Setting a ContrailLength of 5 or lower results either in the Contrail not being drawn, or a crash like the one above (seems to vary a little, depending on the projectile speed).

exception.log for the crashes: 
Exception of type `System.AccessViolationException`: Es wurde versucht, im geschützten Speicher zu lesen oder zu schreiben. Dies ist häufig ein Hinweis darauf, dass anderer Speicher beschädigt ist.

   bei OpenRA.FileFormats.BlowfishKeyProvider.process_predata(Byte\* pre, UInt32 pre_len, Byte\* buf)
   bei OpenRA.FileFormats.BlowfishKeyProvider.DecryptKey(Byte[] src)
   bei OpenRA.FileFormats.MixFile.DecryptHeader(Stream s, Int64 offset, Int64& headerEnd)
   bei OpenRA.FileFormats.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   bei OpenRA.FileFormats.FileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)

data.title: Tiberian Sun CD Install Logic
data.body: Basic install logic which will copy the required files from a Tiberian Sun CD. It will not copy firestorm content which at this point in time is required by the mod.

data.title: Formations
data.body:
All units stick together as they don't move faster than the slowest unit in the selected group. Original RA95.exe shortcut was F. http://ra.afraid.org/html/ra/hotkeys.html

The original implementation had an exploitable bug as it did speed up slow moving units when grouped together with fast ones. http://ra.afraid.org/html/extra/cheats.html Obviously this should be avoided.

Wished at:
- https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2740#issuecomment-15783978
- http://openra.res0l.net/news/release-20130915/#comment-1052353859

data.title: Chronoshift desync
data.body:
Reported in IRC: http://www.diffchecker.com/le6lb7v0

It appears that the mgg and ltnk are having the Chronoshiftable properties set without actually chronoshifting them.

data.title: Fixed map Training Camp
data.body: No one noticed, but this map has several unbuildable units and will crash once you capture the weapon factory and select the vehicle tab.

data.title: Map auto-download creates empty maps which the game does not like
data.body:
Seen in #3875 and #3724 and also experienced this myself. You get zero byte .oramap files which have hashes as file-names therefore the only one to blame is #2823. It junks up the map folder and creates argument null exceptions when the game tries to mount empty zip files.

A way to reproduce might be watching replays or joining servers of older or deleted versions of an existing map probably in conjunction with something that causes the map download to fail like content.open-ra.org giving 404 because the map does not exist there or the webserver does not respond in time.

Whatever the cause. Those empty ghost files should not stay in the maps folder.

data.title: Unreachable crate behind refinery
data.body:
A crate landed top left of the refinery (just behind it). I tried to send riflemen to it, but when I right click to select the area of the crate, instead it selects the entrance to the refinery, and the riflemen block my ore trucks.

OpenRA release-20130915

data.title: Cannot import maps with RA anthills
data.body:
mods\ra\tilesets\temperat.yaml

Line 3589 + 3590

The template ID is 592 - changing to 400 seems to fix this, because that's what it was in RA1. Was there a specific reason we didn't use the original RA ID in the first place?

data.title: "nickname" has disconnected should be "nickname (Spectator)" has disconnected if he is spec (in started game)
data.body: or something like that.

data.title: Cannot detect/recognize/load data from C&C:The First Decade DVD
data.body:
After starting ORA and selecting the RA or C&C mods, I place the C&C:The First Decade DVD in to my drive. Then I select the load from CD button and immediately receive a "disk not found error." The drive and dvd are functional since I had it installed in wine at one point and I can open the dvd's contents.

I'm guessing that ORA just doesn't support DVD's/The First Decade in which case this is a feature request rather then a bug. Anyway I though an issue should be made.

OS: Ubuntu 12.04 LTS
game version: playtest-20130915 pre-compiled .deb

data.title: Health.Radius visualization for mod devs
data.body:
In my opinion the health radius is an underrated feature, the lack of something like this is one of the things that always annoyed me about WW's games.

However, it's hard to tell without any visual indicator how large exactly the radius is. An option for mod devs to enable a visualization of the currently set health radius would be nice.

data.title: Overhaul spatial caching
data.body:
This splits the old SpatialBins trait into two, and only updates positions when they change (the old code used to recalculate everything each tick).

It cuts about 1ms from the start-game tick on Zeus (16ms -> 15ms), and removes some of the assumptions blocking isometric terrain.

data.title: Added IsAlliedWith check to Heal
Add IRC client to the serverbrowser
Save Replays in per Mod and Version folders
data.body:
as discussed in #2152 this will save replays in $HOME/.openra/Replays/$mod/$version instead of putting it all into one folder. That has several advantages:
- No more https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/FAQ#old-replays-crash-the-game reports.
- Faster loading in the replay browser because fewer files need to get parsed.
- Easier to clean up and maintain that folder as it can grow huge.
